The basic expression looks like 2d8+15. You can have multiple types of dice: 2d8+3d6+15.

If any of the dice are rerollable (like brutal weapon dice), then use the reroll(r) button to get an expression like: 3d12r2+4d6+12. This expression will reroll the d12s if they are 2 or lower, but not the d6s.

You can also specify a high crit range (only on d20s) using the crit(c) button: 1d20c18 will notify you of crits on rolls of 18 or higher.

You can't put the reroll modifier on d20s and you can't put the crit modifier on non-d20s.

Welcome to the Condition Tracker. The first thing that you will want to do is use the \'Add Character\' menu option to enter the basic information for your first character. Data does get saved automatically between sessions. Use taps and long-presses to interact with the onscreen widgets; tapping the HP minus graphic will cause you to lose 1 hit point, but a long-press will allow you to enter massive amounts of damage. Gee, that sounds like fun...DM, do your worst!

Welcome to the dice roller. You can create typical expressions like 1d8+1d6+12 and even give these expressions names. Two expressions have been created for you. Use the \'Edit\' button to modify these expressions or to create new ones in the space provided. These expressions will be saved for later sessions. Use the \'Roll\' button to do the obvious. Finally, the \'Max\' button will give you the option to maximize the expression and optionally enter bonus damage in the same form (like 3d6). There is also a \'History\' if you need to check your last 20 or so rolls. You can read more about advanced options like creating expressions with rerolls and bigger crit ranges from the \'Dice Roller Help\' option in the menu.
Recall that temporary hit points do not stack.
